name: The Westin Palace Madrid

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent two nights at the Westin Palace in April. We arrived in Spain jetlagged and tired. We were able to check in right away and were happy with the quality of the hotel and our room. It was very clean and comfortable, as expected. We booked the room using Starwood points, and the Starwood level had a table with tea and apples set up for guests. Breakfast was not included, so we didn't eat (or have drinks) at the hotel.
reviews.title: Pleasant stay

reviews.text: The location of the hotel is excellent, within walking distance of the Prado and the train station and is also walkable to Sol and the Plaza Santa Ana, though we did take the train a couple of times.
reviews.title: How can a hotel be a 5 star without wireless internet?

reviews.text: The only hiccup during our stay involved transportation from the airport. I had called the hotel inquiring if they had a shuttle service from the airport. The gentleman I spoke with said they did, and he took our flight info. When we arrived at the airport, a private car picked us up. We were surprised, but the driver did not charge us. It was only when we checked out of the hotel that we were charged 100 Euros(!) The concierge had never mentioned the charge, and we were under the impression that it would be a complimentary shuttle, not a private car. Needless to say, it put a damper on our experience.
reviews.title: Great hotel but little things would make a difference

reviews.text: Our stay was otherwise enjoyable (short but sweet) and made our transition into Spain very pleasant.
reviews.title: heavenly

reviews.text: If you are interested in spending over $50 for a hamburger and $30 to have wireless internet on one computer for 24h, this is the place for you. You do get free shoe shine cloths though! The service is less than I have received in many less expensive hotels.
reviews.title: Perfect location, gorgeous hotel!

reviews.text: When staying city-center in Madrid, I always pick either the Westin Palace or the Ritz. The two properties are basically right across the Paseo del Prado from one another, and I personally find them quite comparable, so much so that I let price alone be the determining factor in my choice of stay.
reviews.title: Certainly on Par with the Ritz....Especially in The Renovated Rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As has been mentioned in some reviews of the Ritz, my room there was slightly tired, but not enough so to be objectionable. I prefer the drive-up appeal of the Ritz, but prefer the common areas of the Palace.
reviews.title: Classy hotel in excellent rotation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am an SPG Gold and was staying on an amazingly reasonable promotional rate. The first room I was given was not a renovated room, so I asked the desk to move me up to an SPG floor where the rooms were renovated, and they gladly and quickly did so. The rooms are elegantly done up, and the baths are large and luxurious.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel but $25 hot dog?!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The courtyard rooms have only a view of the interior common area cupola and other rooms, but I prefer that in central Madrid because traffic buzzes until almost dawn on weekends and the courtyard provides an excellent noise barrier for a good night's sleep.
reviews.title: magnificent belle epoque hotel in great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've found the staff to be a bit more relaxed and casual than at the Ritz, but the care is excellent, with people making an effort to remember my name, which is impressive in a hotel of its size.
reviews.title: Fantastic hote, would stay at again. Construction going on outside the hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent location for museums and restaurants. Lovely beds, fair but expensive breakfast. Free business center web connection and free spa usage. Overall a fine choice, better location than the Ritz.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel for visiting Madrid

reviews.text: I stayed here in early March for several nights. I had used the SPG points and cash option to give me a nightly rate of $60. When I checked in, the lady at the front desk said, "We are upgrading you at no charge." I couldn't believe it. You can imagine my dismay when I went to the room and smelled cigarette smoke. Someone had definitely smoked in that room. I went back downstairs and the woman gave me an equally nice room on the same floor. She apologized profusely. I still couldn't believe I was getting a super nice room. The staff is lovely, especially the staff on the SPG floor where I stayed. I couldn't justify spending money on the expensive breakfast so I missed out on that. (I stayed here two years ago and splurged on the breakfast once back then.) The hotel is near everything I wanted to see: Prado, Queen Sofia and Thyssen. Plus it's a quick walk to Sol and almost anything else you want to see in Madrid. The restaurants on the street where the guest entrance to the hotel is are great for the most part. I will stay at this hotel again without a doubt and I recommend it highly.
reviews.title: Great hotel near everything

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You can't beat this hotel's location. A short walk to all the interesting points in Old Madrid, including the Prado.
reviews.title: Excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel itself is old fashioned grandeur, done best in five star hotels in European cities. The lobby area is surprisingly small, but the staff are courteous and helpful. We did not eat here (I thought €75 per person for Sunday brunch was a little steep) but we did drink in the bar. Again, prices are not cheap, though the staff were helpful and attentive.
reviews.title: Great Location, yet double standards

reviews.text: The room itself was well appointed, although small. Our room overlooked the Thyssen-Bornernisza museum, but we did not find it too noisy, even on Saturday evening.
reviews.title: Great Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have stayed at this hotel several times over the last few years so that should say something about my opinion of the place. However, this time I found that standards have slipped but prices have risen.
reviews.title: Skip the breakfasts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While I can forgive the fact that the hotel entrance resembles something of a bomb site apparently due to Spanish government economic stimulus initiatives which have resulted in much of central Madrid’s streets being overhauled simultaneously, it is what happens inside the hotel that is my primary concern.
reviews.title: No appreciation for loyal Starwood members

reviews.text: On check-in I was upgraded to a newly refurbished Executive Room which was surprisingly small. I wonder how much space would be available in the lesser Deluxe and Standard rooms. Anyway, the room was modern, comfortable and quiet.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But the breakfasts were a great disappointment. Fortunately my tariff included breakfast, but anyone paying the exorbitant price for it separately would be doubly disappointed. Flavourless coffee, incompetently cooked eggs, fermenting stewed fruits, slow replenishment of buffet, and indifferent service attendants undermined my otherwise pleasant 4 night stay at this hotel.
reviews.title: Not all that impressive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the other hand, the fitness centre is surprisingly good – large and well equipped for a hotel – and was usually empty of other hotel guests.
reviews.title: Simply the classiest and most convenient place in all of Madrid!

reviews.text: This hotel certainly has one of the best locations you can imagine, just 2 minutes from prado in the center of the city - which on the other hand makes it a noisy place. But with closed windows it is ok and aircondition is working efficiently and silently.
reviews.title: could be better

reviews.text: The Palace is a beautiful old hotel with a stunning hall. Rooms are small as in most city hotels but testefully furnished. You can see that it is a chain hotel, rooms are as like as two peas in a pod - maybe a re-upholstery would do good.
reviews.title: Westin Palace-Nice, expensive

reviews.text: We needed nearly more than half an hour to check in and this seems to be standard because we always saw lots of guests waiting at the front desk - should not happen in a 5star hotel.
reviews.title: Fantastic location - pure luxury!

reviews.text: The promoted "heavenly beds" have extremely soft mattrasses and are not new so tht we woke up with a bad backache.
reviews.title: Almost Fit for a Queen or King
Great Hotel, Fab Location, Poor Service
reviews.text: Smokers do not have an easy life at the Westin Palace as there are just two small rooms where it is allowed to smoke: one of them is a showroom for replicas open during the day from 11-16.00 and does not have any chair (!) the other one is used for parties and in the evening booked by groups.... in the restaurant, bar etc. it is strictly forbidden to smoke and there is no terrace or pavement cafe. I have seen elegant ladies smoking outside the entrance ....
Great location for museums and a short walk to the central shopping area. Clean and comfortable with great food. A bit pricey for a holiday hotel but an excellent choice for business.
reviews.title: A very comfortable, traditional hotel in a good location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 3 nights in March to celebrate our wedding anniversary. On checking in we asked for a room with a front view and we were duly obliged. The bedroom was a decent size but the best thing of the room was the view to the front and amazing beds. For $4000 you can buy the full bed and bedding!
reviews.title: Pure class with central location

reviews.text: Breakfast was a treat in an amazing room with huge coppula . Everything you could want to eat they had .
reviews.title: Wow!
Great location and upgraded rooms
reviews.text: The hotel is so central , literally minutes from Prado Museum , shopping , parks , squares . All very easily walkable from the hotel. Concierge were helpful and organised a cycle tour through the local tourist information centre in Plaza Mayor.

Only down side was drink costs and snacks in bar . We paid about €80 euros for 2 sandwiches and a few drinks , seemed over the top.All in all though I would recommend this hotel to anyone staing in Madrid who is looking for a 5 star hotel.
reviews.title: Fabulous hotel! Loved every minute!

reviews.text: We stayed at the Westin for three nights during a well earned short break in Madrid.
reviews.title: Great Hotel - apart from the 8am renovations!

reviews.text: The hotel is in an ideal location within walking distance of most attractions, and some excellent restaurants. The staff were all very helpful and efficient. The accomodation is very spacious, and well equiped, although some areas required some re decoration. The lobby area / bar and restaurant are all stunning.
reviews.title: Thin walls...neighbours easily heard=> no sleep

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unfortunately, on our first and second days, we were rudely awaken from our sleep by extemely loud renovation works taking place directly above us. On the first day this began at 9am, and 8am on the second. We complained about this and to be fair, the response of the management was very fast and generous and could not be faulted.
reviews.title: Luxury Hotel, service not great

likes.disliked: — Service at breakfast, bar and concierge

reviews.text: This hotel probably deserves a higher rating, but depriving us of our sleep during a short break is a serious matter.
reviews.title: Lovely, but the service has slipped

reviews.text: Long wait upon checkin, understaffed concierge always waiting. Fancy lobby, great afternoon tea or drink in the bar, traditional luxury design of common areas, long corridoors of rooms. Bed was comfortable maybe a little bit soft for my taste, bathroom ok but no seperate shower which i think a 5 star hotel bathroom should have. The room seemed recently renovated and staff told me that 6 floor was renovated.
reviews.title: Great location!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here 3 nights in the past 10 days on my recent visit to Spain, and I wouldn't stay anywhere else when visiting this city. Staff is extremely friendly and beyond helpful, hotel itself is beautiful, and it is centrally located to all major attractions in the city. It has great energy, and old world library bar makes it a Madrid hot spot. Bed's are extremely comfortable, and rooms are very quiet, and hotel is very secure. Don't miss the brunch!
reviews.title: Best Place to Stay in Madrid

reviews.text: Good hotel with great location. Rooms are a bit dated (at least mine was) but reception, bar and restaurant areas are all fine. Very good food at the hotel. Service OK. Will stay here again next time I'm visiting Madrid.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: I spend a lot of time in hotels, but seldom more than one night in any single hotel - so whats most important for me is that the hotel gets it right the first time around - and the Westin let me down a few times in the 12 hours that I was a guest.
reviews.title: No match for the Ritz (across the stret)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1. patchy wireless internet that would work for a few seconds and then shut off for a few seconds. When I highlighted the problem to the person at check-out, he just shrugged his shoulders. For an issue that caused me to waste a lot of time, I expected more than a shug of shoulders. He didnt even note the problem, which leads me to believe that it wont be corrected the next time I visit Madrid.
reviews.title: great hotel great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2. forgetful egg-maker - I asked for some eggs at breakfast and came back a few mins later to discover that my order had been ignored. So I reminded the man and came back again - still no eggs! I was in a hurry and in no mood to beg for eggs so left slightly hungry. To forget once is human - to forget twice is simply negligent!
reviews.title: Excellent hotel in a terrific location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from spending 3 nights at the Westin Palace in Madrid. Our trip had an unfortunate start when my wallet was pickpocketed while walking around the neighborhood of the hotel. I immediately contacted the concierge and she jumped into action and helped me cancel my credit cards. She was extremely kind and helpful in a very stressful situation. She even sent us some sparkling water and a fruit plate along with a letter letting us know that she was there if we needed any additional help. She really came through for us! Our room was quiet and comfortable. We loved the heavenly bed and heavenly shower. We also had dinner at the rotunda restaurant and drinks at the bar. Service was outstanding and we would stay here again. Although, next time I'll wear a money belt.
reviews.title: Beautiful, comfortable hotel with a great concierge!

likes.liked: — Heavenly bed and showers, Great concierge!
likes.disliked: — Be careful of pickpockets in the neighborhood!

reviews.text: Madrid's Westin Palace is just that: a palace. As many have stated, one cannnot beat the location or the public rooms. It's an 8-iron from the Prado and that other fine museum with the hard name to pronounce. Do see it, though.
reviews.title: It's grand in location, decor, rooms so-so.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The common areas are fabulous. The standard rooms, those not on the SPG floors: kinda ok, sort of typical. Really nothing to write home about, and I do write about my hotels...a lot. It's a nice, decent, hotel. The problem is it can be one of the more pricey properties around.
reviews.title: Great Location, So-So Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2004, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I found the desk staff to be quite accomodating and helpful. they're pro's, it shows. Concierge was ok, not out of this world, not a total hobo. I tried room service, not bad, but did not otherwise eat in the hotel. Actually, you shouldn't, we're talking Madrid here, baby! If you cannot have great food in Madrid, you might as well stick a fork in your proverbial bad self.
reviews.title: Grand Building, Cold Person

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Westin Madrid Palace is a fine property, it's just not blockbuster great. Good, solid, fine....ok, but not "grand".
reviews.title: First Class

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Dates: 30 March-2 April 2012
reviews.title: Conservative luxury
Best Hotel Experience Ever!
reviews.text: Webb: www.westinpalacemadrid.com/
Internet: Not free and very expensive
reviews.title: A perfect place for a pleasure or business trip to Madrid
Great Place to Stay, Well Located
reviews.text: Style: Classic large Luxury hotel
Situation: Excellent location next to Thyssen and Prado museum. 5 minutes to Retiro park. Plaza Mayor about 10 min.
reviews.title: Awesome stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I just returned from a 4 night stay using my Starwood points for a room at this property in Madrid. I am a platinum Starwood member and try to use points at the nicer properties because they are so expensive and especially in the European locations.
reviews.title: Westin Madrid. Worn but decent

likes.disliked: — thin walls, worn room and lousy mattress

reviews.text: What I liked best about this property was the location which is excellent. The Prado was next door as was the modern museum of art on the other side of the square. There is a Starbucks located in the same block for decent coffee and a pastry. There is a Spanish version of Dennys called VIPS which you can get food cheaper than most restaurants but it is not very interesting just filling.
reviews.title: Best in Madrid

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What I did not like about the hotel is that they gouge you for everything. A small bottle of water was almost $7. The rollaway was $50 euros a night and a cup of coffee in the hotel was almost $5. Stay away from the overpriced and not very interesting breakfast buffet which is 22 euros. The concierge made lousy restaurant recommendations where the Tapas food was not only terrible in quality but high in price. We made a point of returning to let him know that it was a poor recommendation and he thanked us but the next day I returned for another reason and overheard him giving out the same recommendation to another customer. Typically this means they are getting some sort of kickback to steer you to certain places to eat. Avoid the concierge for anything but directions.
reviews.title: grande dame!

reviews.text: The rooms walls were thin and we heard everyone’s door open and close as well as the room above us. We were in a superior room which was spacious but a bit worn. Rather so-so. The rate for this room was over 500 euros a night and I would have fled after the first night but we were using points to stay there so I did not mind. It is a decent hotel to stay in if you can use points and absurdly overpriced for the prices they charge for the accommodations you get. Our queen size bed had seen a better day since the springs tended to squeak when we got out of the bed. We faced the square which was kind of cool but the constant street noise meant you kept your window closed.
reviews.title: Westin Palace- centrally located

likes.liked: — Location across the street from The Prado museum

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In the end it was fine because we were using points but this hotel is not worth what they are charging for a room.
reviews.title: Palace at a Price

likes.liked: — A genuine air of class that pervaded all aspects of our stay
likes.disliked: — frankly silly prices of food and drink

reviews.text: Chose this hotel over the Ritz Carlton for a city break. Was pleasantly surprised. Lovely classy, clean hotel, great location and the bedrooms were tastefully decorated. I had read about the beds and can now truly say that the beds were the best we have slept in. The breakfast was superb with great choice; hot omelettes made for you, plenty of fruit, cereals and pastisseries. The drinks bar and the hotel restaurant prices are too high - so best to eat out.
reviews.title: classy hotel with excellent service

reviews.text: The only negative point would be that when we arrived, I found the reception staff cold and alittle unfriendly. No greetings, no warmth!! But the Conceirge were fantastic, very helpful and accommodating.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel--Well worth it!

reviews.text: Overall a lovely hotel and was glad that we stayed here and would definitely stay here again. Highly recommend it.
reviews.title: Perfect Hotel in Perfect Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Westin Palace is definitely one of the top hotels in Madrid. It is very classy, chic, and modern. The service is excellent--from the bell boys to the concierge, maids, and restaurant staff. The rooms are very elegant and comfortable and have every amenity you could desire. We really loved their breakfast. It was definitely one of the best breakfasts we had throughout Spain--it had everything (including made-to-order eggs, omelettes!). We definitely prefer the Westin to the Ritz, as the Ritz is pretty stuffy, located further from the city center (Sol), and was pretty empty when we went to go check it out. The hotel is located about a 7 minute walk from the city center (nice because it is complete chaos in the city center), and 2 minutes from the Prado, Thyssen Museum, and Parque Retiro. I would definitely recommend the Westin for anyone looking for a comfortable, classy place to stay during their time in Madrid.
reviews.title: Majestic beauty and prices to match

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently had an excellent stay at the Westin Palace for 5 nights. When we arrived we were greeted by Alberto at the front desk. It was immediately apparent that the staff at this hotel is well trained and knows what they are doing. We were upgraded to a starwood preferred room and Alberto made sure that our two year old was included as part of our hotel/breakfast rate. This is where I believe they go the extra mile as far as service is concerned. You don't have to ask, they already know what you're thinking. The hotel is beautiful. I looked at some of the pictures of the hotel prior to arrival and was concerned that this hotel would be a little too old and stuffy but I was wrong. The hotel is classic and modern. When you enter the lobby, there is a staircase that leads you to the elevators. I was concerned about taking the stroller up and down but not to worry, the staff was ready to help as soon as they saw me coming. Our room was on the 6th floor facing the back of the hotel because we requested a quiet room. The room as very quiet and the curtains completely black out the light. Now, let's talk about the bed, it was really, really comfortable as were the pillows. We brought our own todler bed for our son and housekeeping even made his bed everyday. This hotel is very accomodating to guest with young children. The hotel restaurant has high chairs and they brought hot water to our room when asked (free of charge of course). After snoozing and freshing up we headed out. The hotel location could not be better. You are across from the Prado and Thyssen, a 10 minute walk to the Reina Sofia and right in the middle of a neighborhood known for its old school tapas bars. Everything is within walking distance from the hotel, even Atocha Station (15 minutes). So, if you have to pay a little more to stay here, it's well worth it since you'll save yourself a bunch of cab fares. Overall, I would have to say this was our best hotel experience while in Spain for two weeks. The hotel stay added to our good impression of Madrid. We'll be back!
reviews.title: Second Time was as Charming

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Westin Palace is a luxury hotel located walking distance from every major attraction in Madrid. Most of the reviewers have already said everything to be said about this hotel and I would just like to say - if you are planning to be in Madrid, book this hotel now!
reviews.title: Luxury and Location!

reviews.text: This hotel is luxury, the name makes that obvious. The staff was super friendly, knowledgeable, and a mix of all walks of Madrid - able to point you to places where all the locals go food, shopping, night life. The locale of this hotel is by far the best crowning achievment. The available cervasrias, musumes, metro, bistros, etc. A definate stay for someone on looking to explore a city.
reviews.title: Stay for luxury, wow'd by the locale.

reviews.text: This is a lovely, comfortable hotel in a great location....walking distance to the Prado and Reina Sofia and a great selection of tapas bars in the surrounding streets. We stayed on the fourth floor in an executive room which was comfortable and spacious. Best beds! The concierge desk was extremely helpful which is so important in a big city.
reviews.title: Splendid hotel in great location

reviews.text: One of the more ornate and visually impressive hotels I've visited. Quality room and great service. The location was great for walking. Breakfast and cocktails on property are quite expensive. That's the only downside. We're talking 8 euros for an 8 oz coca-cola. As long as you're not drinking at the bar, it's a great place and decent value.
reviews.title: Stayed here for work conference

reviews.text: I have stayed at this hotel three times so far. While pricey (thus my title) it is well worth it. The staff is European courteous and speaks a multitude of languages, including Chinese dialects and that is not just the front desk, but throughout the hotel. The rooms are spacious under European standards including two wardrobes and double sinks. Views are a little iffy. Many of the rooms have no view, so if you are going for the first time you may want to pay for a view facing the Prado, which brings me to my next point; the location.
reviews.title: Luxury (for a price) with a Wonderful Location (for a price)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is beautiful and located near parks and Museum. I stay 2 nitgh in dicember, ervery think so good, staff, service, room...Tks
reviews.title: Very nice!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Palace as part of a Travel Agent Booking. Unfortunately it was only 1 night! We arrived late the afternoon and only had time to walk around a bit and visited a few Tapas Bars. Food is excellent, and everybody is so friendly and helpful. The Hotel is beautiful, and the bed was the MOST comfortable we EVER slept in!! We did not even go out that night, just got into bed early to read and enjoy the soft, fluffy pillows! Unfortunately I cannot comment on the Breakfast or any of the Restaurants in the Hotel, but it IS a 5 star Hotel and obviously the prices match. Still a good, comfortable, beautiful Hotel. Next time we will stay in Madrid longer!!
reviews.title: Best Bed EVER!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a fine hotel. The rooms are quiet and comfortable, the service is friendly and knowledgeable, and the location near the Prado Museum is ideal. We especially enjoyed the spectacular breakfast buffet.
reviews.title: Beautiful breakfast in the rotunda

reviews.text: The building itself is great; the decor in the main lobby is lovely; the staff are very friendly and not overly formal; and the location is fantastic (literally across the street from the Prado). But the rooms were a little worn. Tired carpet and dinged up furnishings. No coffee service in room. I was told I was given a non-smoking room, but, from the smell, the room had clearly been smoked in frequently. I was too tired to complain. The thermostat in the room was unintelligible (and I speak Spanish). The room was extremely hot and I could not sleep well as a result.
reviews.title: Old world charm=a little frayed around the edges

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I loved the Westin Palace, inside and out! From the moment we arrived I felt like I was part of a special experience. The check-in procedure was flawless, cordial and informative, and the hotel was gracious enough to let us have our room even though we arrived at 10 am. The Heavenly beds were indeed heavenly....so, so comfortable. The bathroom was beautiful with nice toiletries, plenty of hot water and comfy robes. Our room was on the third floor and beautifully quiet: no outside or inside noise at all. A prior reviewer mentioned the room being far away from the elevator but that's exactly what I always request: always! The farther away from the elevator, the smaller the number of people passing your door which gives me the extra peace and quiet I want. The fitness center was well-equipped and I wish I had been able to experience the Asian restaurant at the rear of the hotel. I heard the food was delicious but they don't begin serving until 8:30, which is later than I like to eat. The location of the hotel is absolutely unbeatable: in sight of the Neptune fountain, walking distance to Plaza de Cibeles, across the street from the Thyssen-Bornemisza (great Impressionist/post-impressionart art) and the Prado, and a very, very short walk to the Reina-Sofia museums featuring art by Picasso, Dali, etc. The Thyssen was my favorite of the three and you can grab a bite to eat there too if you are totally enthralled with the art as I was. The Edward Hopper masterpieces alone are worth the price. We purchased Madrid tourist passes online prior to the trip that saved a lot of money but primarily lots of time since you get to skip the lines. This included numerous attractions but one we particularly enjoyed was the Palacio Real Madrid with its fabulous collection of stringed instruments for my musician husband to ooh and aah over. (Madrid Card holders enter in a separate entrance).The palace was close enough to the hotel to walk and enjoy the sights and sounds of Madrid along the way, including Plaza Mayor. Since we stopped so frequently, I'm not sure how long it would take to walk to but probably around 30 minutes or slightly more. Plaza Mayor was fun and believe it or not, Elvis Presley is alive and well in Madrid! We also enjoyed the Parque de Retiro, a very short walk from the hotel as well. The park itself is beautiful and if you love to watch people, this is a great opportunity to see a little bit of family life in Madrid, particularly around the water. If you're interested in flamenco, tap as fast as you can to Corral de la Moreria. (We took transportation since the show starts late at night). I did a huge amount of research on which flamenco show to attend and came up with this one, bought tickets online before the trip and was so glad I did. The talent at this show is unbelievable and not to be missed. When I mentioned to the concierge that we were going to see flamenco, he immediately stated that the best in Madrid was Corral de la Moreria but unfortunately they were sold out and would be unable to get us tickets, so I was ecstatic that I already had purchased the tickets. The place was indeed packed but what a fun experience that we will never forget! The area close to the hotel seemed very safe and we felt very comfortable walking around. There are numerous restaurants close by. If tapas are your pleasure, you will be in heaven....and that's just the way we felt at the Westin too....a perfect stay in a fabulous location!
reviews.title: Fabulous Location, Beautiful Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Westin Palace was perfect, great location, fantastic service, nice comfortable room and terrific buffet breakfast. We arrived Saturday am non stop from Dulles and went right to the Westin Palace, got in our upgraded room on the 6th floor @10am. We walked every where and went for runs in the park both mornings....just terrific! Thanks CJ at Amex Travel for recommending.
reviews.title: Awesome weekend in Madrid

reviews.text: Gracious hotel in a great location close to everything. room was comfortable, well appointed and service fine. Concierges knowledgable and friendly. Food and drink in hotel somewhat pricey, not unexpected, but atmosphere is nice. Our breakfast was included and the buffet is fresh and expansive. I would recommend this hotel to others..one complaint... Internet is pricey if you're not spg. Otherwise, great hotel, great service and a location that can't be beat.
reviews.title: Best location, fine hotel

reviews.text: I have stayed at this hotel twice, once on business and once with family. Simply put this is the best possible location for Madrid as a tourist. It is across the street from the Prado and the Thyssen Bornezema. 5 minutes to the Atocha train station in a taxi or metro. 12 minutes to the Puerta Del Sol, and 15 minutes to the Plaza Mayor and Mercado San Miguel. It is maybe 20 minutes to the heart of La Latina. It is a grand old hotel with fully updated rooms with great bathrooms and plasma tvs. Wifi works well here. The buffet breakfast is pricey but elegant and great for choice. The ballroom they have it in is spectacular and a great way to start the day. There are many great Bars and tapas joints within 5 minutes walk. There is even a Starbucks built into the front side of the building.
reviews.title: Best Location in Town

reviews.text: Comfortable, well equipped rooms with outstanding service. Great restaurant in the hotel too. Housekeeping staff goes well above and beyond. Loved the stay.
reviews.title: The best most comfortable stay in Madrid

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Westin Madrid Palace is one of those lovely turn of the century (19th to 20th) hotels that embraced elegance in a way that made travelers feel like kings. The Westin's updates are all within the parameteres you would expect in carrying through with this theme. The beautiful glass dome over the dining room (visible from the lobby) is just a part of the overwhelming sense of old-fashioned elegance that reigns here.
reviews.title: Old-Fashioned Elegance, Fit for a King

reviews.text: Lots to like with the hotel. The lobby is impressive. The check-in process was somewhat slow but the staff seemed to be genuine in their desire to be helpful; English is spoken. Since we’re Starwood members we were “upgraded” to the Starwood floor on check-in. I also have to say that we were able to check in before Noon without a hassle, which is nice.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room, 608, was very pleasant. The room is not big but it is comfortable. There’s a queen sized bed, a good sized writing desk with lamp, TV in a cabinet, reading chair and lamp, end tables with lamps by the bed. There is a plentiful amount of closet space which is great. An in-room safe is included in our price. The bathroom is decent size and the toilet is in a small room off the bathroom. While our two windows were on the small size and somewhat high up (and will only open four inches by design) the view is pleasant. With the windows closed there is no street noise except for the occasional siren. There is only moderate noise from the hallway and from the adjoining rooms. The bed was comfortable. It was hot while we were there but the air conditioner worked great. The hotel is very well located to the city sites that we wanted to see and not too far from the train station.
reviews.title: Very Good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Now to the issues: first, there’s no free wi-fi. Wi-fi is something like 19E per day, which is ridiculous. However, there is a business center where you can use the computers for free (there are six or eight of them). If you time it right there’s no problem getting a computer, however one day I went down there twice and they were all occupied both times. Not surprising for a big hotel. It would also be nice if the hotel would put an extra chair or two in there; a couple of times when I went down to use the computers there were computers available but no chairs as couples had pulled chairs over so that they could both sit down and read the computer monitor.
reviews.title: Exceptional service in a landmark property.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Maid service: it’s a little thing but I am surprised that we didn’t have turn-down service, especially on an “upgraded” floor (we were there four nights and it didn’t happen any night). Not that I can’t turn down my own sheets but I would have appreciated getting fresh towels. While we were in Madrid it was HOT and we went through our towels. One day we didn’t get fresh hand towels and our soiled face clothes were taken away and not replaced. If towels aren’t going to be replaced during the day then it would be nice if the maid service would leave an extra towel or two in the bathroom (we each got one towel a day, which seemed stingy for an upscale hotel).
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel in best location let down by service.

reviews.text: As to the room itself, there are two issues that I’ll mention: first, the pillows. It has to be hard for the hotels to deal with the pillow issue: too hard, too soft, too small, etc. And pillows must regularly get worn out. We had two pillows on each side of the bed: a good sized one that went completely flat when touched, and a decently firm one that was about the size of a sofa pillow (small). The other issue is that our carpet could have used some help. Not dirty but tired; it’s obvious where it has been stained and cleaned over the years. Neither of these were a big deal for us.
reviews.title: Love this place!

reviews.text: Madrid is an amazing city, we have been touring Europe this year and clearly Madrid is in one of our Top 3 choices. The city has unending things to offer, 3 days tour cannot do justice to it. We stayed in Westin Palace which is very close to many "sites" so very conveniently located. The hotel is also extremely comfortable, with good clean room, great staff (who try to speak English and help), very good breakfast - we were very impressed to see some asian selections in the breakfast at reasonable price.
reviews.title: Great hotel, great city

reviews.text: The hotel is very close to Santa Ana plaza, which is a great place to watch people and have Tapas.
reviews.title: Lovely corridors!

reviews.text: Good location, friendly staff, corridors were very grand, rooms a bit chintzy for my liking but nice nonetheless, if quite small. Had two nights of fantastic sleep in very comfy bed! No complaints whatsoever. Pricey but I wasnt paying!
reviews.title: Unbeatable location! Ole!

reviews.text: No need to add much here to what's already been said. The location shares with the NH and Ritz for the best of the city, within walking distance of major museums and government buildings in a nice part of town. There aren't many restaurants within walking distance, which is a slight negative, but in a city like Madrid it's worth taking the taxi or metro and exploring.
reviews.title: Great hotel,great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service was excellent with one exception--when my family and I ate breakfast in the gorgeous restaurant, they all had the buffet and I didn't. The waiter didn't seem to realize that I wanted to order something so he ignored me. I laughed it off and ate very well later in the day.
reviews.title: Very nice
Excellent hotel - great location!
reviews.text: We loved our stay here. Granted, we used our Starwood points and didn't have to pay for our room, but even if I was paying, I would have been pleased. We stayed over Christmas Eve and the hotel looked so beautiful. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful (more so than most). Our room was roomy and comfy. We also had a little balcony that looked over the Neptune fountain.

reviews.title: Very very over priced
reviews.text: When we walked in, we were pretty overwhelmed by how beautiful the lobby was. It's a grand old hotel, but updated nicely. We didn't eat in the hotel at all, but got snacks and sodas from the VIPS in the bottom floor. There was no need for us to spend time at the hotel restaurants and bars when there are so many great places within walking distance. I used to live in Madrid and found this location just about perfect. It was a short walk through the great old neighborhoods to the Plaza Mayor/Puerta del Sol, or to the museums, or even Parque Retiro. I would highly recommend this place, especially if you are there for a short stay and want to have everything close by.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Westin Palace truly does live up to its name.From start to finish this is one fine hotel.When we drove up our baggage and car were whisked away and we were treated to a wonderful experience in the heart of Madrid.The rooms were superb,well appointed and comfortable.The breakfast buffet was second to none and the lounge super relaxing.The Oriental restaurant was a little over rated but I suspect had an off night when we dined.The major problem with this establishment is that it was a little too comfortable so I had a hard time convincing my travel mate to get out to see the sights!!This property has hosted many famous and important personalities,which adds to the ambience, but none more so than my little buttercup,whom I might add did not threaten my well being in the dead of night due to some oversight by hotel staff.Thank-you Westin Palace!
reviews.title: Sherry loves me

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I chose this hotel because of its location close to the Prado, Reina Sofia and the Atocha train station. I read most of the TripAdvisor reviews on this property prior to arriving. The manager allowed us to check in early after an overnight flight. Our room was upgraded and was very nice. The "Heavenly Bed" was extremely comfortable. The reception staff were helpful as was the concierge, Ricardo. We were very happy with our dinner under the rotunda our first night. The concierge recommended the restaurant, Viridiana. I was torn trying to find a great restaurant on my own and Ricardo solved the problem. This restaurant was great! The Westin's breakfast buffet was good, but not a great value. Our room was not worn. The bathroom was very nice and very clean. The maids on the fourth floor were extremely helpful. Last year I stayed at the #1 TripAdvisor hotel in Madrid and this was much better. I will definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Surprisingly Great

reviews.text: From A to Z this hotel scores 5 stars in all departments.
reviews.title: A Must stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I just returned from 7 nights at the Westin Palace in Madrid. This Westin is one of the top hotels in Madrid. It will be celebrating it's 100th year next year. It has a gorgeous dining room with a historic and fabulous stained-glass domed rotunda, and delicious food (and wonderful buffet). A nice, clubby bar. We had what I think was a standard room, and it was very nice, with king-sized "heavenly" bed. The service of housekeeping, room-service, and the concierge was very good. There's a Starbucks in the hotel, although you have to walk outside and around the corner to access it.
reviews.title: Fabulous Hotel

reviews.text: The location could not have been better. Literally right across the street from the Thyssen museum. About a block to the Prado musuem and the Retiro Park. Near the train station. We were able to walk nearly everywhere.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: I highly recommend this hotel and would love to stay there again some day.

description: Built by order of King Alfonso XIII in 1912, The Westin Palace, Madrid was recently restored to its original splendor. Situated near the Prado museum, historic monuments and some of the best tapas restaurants in town, It is listed in the Condé Nast Traveler "Gold List 2010" as one of the best hotels in Spain.
